perturbation.original_text: 2.2 "END USER CUSTOMER SERVICES" means the collective reference to warranty and post warranty (maintenance) services, including standard and enhanced warranty services, made available by McDATA and provided directly to End User Customers.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.2 "END USER CUSTOMER SERVICES" means services, including warranty services, made available by McDATA and, at McDATA's discretion, provided directly or indirectly to End User Customers.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts the typical understanding and legal definition of 'End User Customer Services,' which generally implies a direct service relationship. By adding 'at McDATA's discretion, provided directly or indirectly,' it creates ambiguity and potential for McDATA to avoid direct service obligations, conflicting with consumer protection norms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring clarity and reasonable expectations of service agreements.

perturbation.original_text: 8.1 As used herein, "CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION" will mean any and all technical or business information, including third party information, furnished or disclosed, in whatever form or medium (regardless of whether tangible, Intangible, visual or oral), by one party to the other, including but not limited to information regarding patents and patent applications, trade secrets, works of authorship, software programs, software source documents, software architecture, algorithms, formulae, ideas, techniques, know-how, processes, inventions, apparatuses, equipment, models, information related to current, future and proposed products and services, research, experimental work, development, design details, specifications and engineering information, financial information, procurement, purchasing and manufacturing requirements, potential and actual customer lists, investors, employees, business and contractual relationships, business forecasts, sales and merchandising information, marketing plans; information regarding third parties; and any physical manifestations of Confidential Information (such as notes, reports, memoranda, etc.).
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1 As used herein, "CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION" will mean any information designated as such by the disclosing party. The receiving party must treat information labeled as confidential with reasonable care.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION' is extensive and detailed, aligning with common legal interpretations of trade secrets and proprietary data. The modified definition is extremely vague, removing specific protections for categories like trade secrets and customer lists. This conflicts with established legal precedent for protecting sensitive business information and creates uncertainty about what is actually protected under the agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State trade secret laws, Uniform Trade Secrets Act (UTSA)

perturbation.original_text: 10.4 THE WARRANTIES, IF ANY, PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT (INCLUDING THE APPENDICES AND CHANNEL NOTIFICATION DOCUMENTS) OR AS PROVIDED WITH THE PRODUCTS ARE GIVEN IN LIEU OF ALL OTHER WARRANTIES, WHETHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY, NONINFRINGEMENT OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, ALL OF WHICH ARE HEREBY EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMED AND EXCLUDED.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.4 McDATA provides Products 'as is'. Reseller acknowledges that McDATA shall not be liable for any performance or results or lack thereof that Reseller or End User Customers may experience, in connection to the Product.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause disclaims implied warranties of merchantability and fitness. The changed text effectively removes all warranties, including the express warranties that may be offered with the product. This contradicts consumer protection laws and the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC), which often imply basic guarantees of product quality and functionality, especially in commercial transactions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) - Implied Warranty of Merchantability and Fitness for a Particular Purpose; Consumer Protection Laws
